message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI 

This paper deals with short-text classification, which is a common problem in natural language processing. The proposed method involves training a network of classifiers to predict missing features in a given instance, which is a task that falls under the category of machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper involves the use of graph-based methods and probabilistic modeling, which are common techniques in machine learning and artificial intelligence, respectively. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper involves information retrieval techniques for finding related features, which falls under the category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
